intro: Gnidiopsis burmanni, commonly known as the Burmann's gnidiopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
